_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The ExxonMobil Houston Olefins Plant strives to be a valued and respected member of the community.  Corporate and local plant management and personnel are committed to delivering excellence in the safety, health and environmental (SHE) aspects of plant operations.  In order to achieve excellent SHE performance, a comprehensive SHE management program has been deployed.  This program is outlined below.

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES
ExxonMobil has implemented a SHE management framework via its Operations Integrity Management Systems (OIMS).  OIMS requires a ?management systems? approach to all aspects of SHE performance.  These management systems are designed to ensure that policies/processes/procedures are defined, roles and responsibilities are clarified, performance is measured, and continuous improvement is driven.  

The Houston Olefins Plant has implemented management systems in the following 20 key SHE performance areas:
? Management Leadership, Commitment and Accountability
? Risk Analysis, Assessment and Management
? Facilities Design and Construction
? Process and Facilities Information/Documentation
? Personnel Safety
? Health
? Personnel
? Training
? Operations and Maintenance Procedures
? Work Permits
? Inspection and Maintenance
? Reliability and Control of Defeat of Critical Systems/Devices
? Pollution Prevention
? Regulatory Compliance
? Management of Change
? Third Party Services
? Incident Reporting, Analysis and Follow-Up
? Emergency Preparedness
? Community Awareness
? Operations Integrity Assessment and Improvement


STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED
The Houston Olefins Plant manufactures ethylene, propylene, and two byproducts (a pyrolysis gasoline and an unrefined butadiene stream) for further processing at other industrial facilities.  These chemicals are used as feedstocks for plastics, synthetic fabrics and fuels.

The Houston Olefins Plant contains the following regulated flammable substances

above their 10,000 lb. threshold quantities:  ethane, ethylene, methane, propane, and propylene.

The Houston Olefins Plant no longer contains any regulated toxic substances above a threshold quantity.  Risk management improvements have eliminated the use of chlorine, which was previously the only regulated toxic substance used at the plant.


GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS
Many activities are in place to ensure that the Houston Olefins Plant delivers excellent SHE performance.  An overview of these efforts, grouped into the 20 key SHE management system areas, is provided here.  These activities are designed to ensure compliance with 40 CFR Part 68, 29 CFR 1910.119 (OSHA PSM) and American Chemistry Council Responsible Care requirements.

Management Leadership, Commitment and Accountability
? Sets requirements for members of site management to participate/lead SHE efforts
? Sets SHE expectations for site personnel
? Requires that SHE goals are set and stewarded on a periodic basis

Risk Analysis, Assessment and Management
? Ensures that plant processes are reviewed for hazards using PHA/HAZOP and other risk analysis/assessment techniques
? Requires that the appropriate risk reduction activities are completed as planned

Facilities Design and Construction
? Sets up processes and procedures to ensure new facilities are designed and constructed to appropriate standards

Process and Facilities Information/Documentation
? Sets up processes to manage the various types of ?process safety information? (plant documentation) required to operate the plant

Personnel Safety
? Sets up programs to improve personnel safety performance by helping workers recognize and remove/manage hazards in the workplace

Health
? Ensures that worker and community exposure to workplace hazards (e.g. chemicals, noise, etc.) is at safe levels
? Sets up processes to communicate health information
? Ensures that workers are physically capable of pe

rforming required work tasks

Personnel
? Sets up processes to transfer key job knowledge to both new employees and to employees taking on different job assignments

Training
? Provides training to ensure that workers have the knowledge to safely complete their assigned tasks 
? Sets up a program to schedule training and maintain training records

Operations and Maintenance Procedures
? Ensures that necessary operations and maintenance procedures are in place
? Manages any needed changes to these procedures brought about by plant reconfigurations or operating improvements

Work Permits
? Provides the procedures and policies for permitting work
? Ensures that personnel involved in the permitting process are trained on their roles

Inspection and Maintenance
? Ensures that a system is in place to maintain the mechanical integrity of the plant

Reliability and Control of Defeat of Critical Systems/Devices
? Places special focus on the maintenance of equipment that is critical for SHE performance

Pollution Prevention
? Set up environmental business plans and strategies to reduce pollution

Regulatory Compliance
? Manages an audit process that ensures regulatory compliance with applicable SHE regulations

Management of Change
? Sets up processes to review and approve changes to plant facilities, processes or procedures
? Ensures that changes are appropriately communicated
? Ensures that process safety information and procedures are updated to reflect plant changes

Third Party Services
? Evaluates third party service providers to ensure they meet ExxonMobil SHE requirements
? Ensures that contract employees receive the proper training and orientation to perform work
? Evaluates the SHE performance of third party service providers

Incident Reporting, Analysis and Follow-Up
? Sets guidelines and procedures for reporting and investigating incidents
? Ensures that appropriate learnings/follow-up are captured from incidents

Emergency Preparedness
? Manages the emergency re

sponse structure for the plant
? Ensures that personnel are trained to perform their roles in the emergency response organization

Community Awareness
? Encourages employee involvement in the community

Operations Integrity Assessment and Improvement
? Conducts periodic assessment of the health of the OIMS management systems


FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY
The Houston Olefins Plant has experienced no accidents meeting 40 CFR Part 68 reporting requirements in the past 5 years.  


EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
The Houston Olefins Plant?s emergency response structure is comprised of an Incident Command function directing the plant?s Fire Brigade and Emergency Response Team with the support of the Emergency Operations Center.  This emergency response structure is staffed by on-site personnel trained to respond to plant emergencies.  In addition, the plant is a member of the Channel Industries Mutual Aid (CIMA) organization made up of industrial facilities along the Houston Ship Channel and surrounding areas.  This mutual aid involvement ensures the availability of additional emergency response capability from neighboring plants, if needed.

The Houston Olefins Plant is a member of the Houston LEPC to ensure proper community interface on emergency preparedness information.  Also, the plant participates in various EHCMA programs to ensure proper community interface (e.g. CAER line, Odor Network, etc.).


PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
The Houston Olefins Plant?s SHE programs are constantly being improved via the built-in ?continuous improvement? cycle required by OIMS.  Improvement goals are set, stewarded and audited per the OIMS design.
